intro: Humboltia beyrichii, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. Humboltia beyrichii is adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. It plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for various insects and birds.
